v-st in space between next 2 v-sts 2 times v-st in 3rd st of the beg chain 4 turn 4 v-st row 2 chain 4 v-st in the chain-2 space of the next 2 v-sts chain 1 double_crochet in 3rd chain of the beg chain 4 turn 2 v-st 2 double_crochet 2 chain 1 space row 3 chain 3 *double_crochet in space before v-st double_crochet in chain-2 space of the v- st repeat from * once double_crochet in space after v-st double_crochet in 3rd chain of beg chain 4 turn 7 double_crochet row 4 chain 3 skip 2 sts work decrease in next st and top of beg chain 3 note to work decrease yo insert hook in next st yo pull up loop yo pull through 2 loops skip next sts yo insert hook in top of chain 3 yo pull up loop yo pull through 2 loops yo pull through 3 loops on hook chain 3 slip_stitch into the space between the double_crochet to form a ring fasten_off © on needlesandhooks 4 beaded fringe if you are attaching beads to scarf tie coordinating thread to the loop at the end using a beading needle pass thread through the focal bead the smaller beads and the seed bead then pass back through the smaller beads the focal bead and through the loop repeat two more times going back through the same focal bead each time fasten_off thread bury tail and weave in ends if you are making detachable fringe tie the thread to the clasp hook tassel wrap yarn around piece of cardboard or a small book until the tassel reaches desired length thread a piece of yarn under all the loops on 1 end and tie tightly then cut through all the yarn on the opposite end you can either use a piece of yarn from the tassel or use another piece of yarn to tie and then wrap around approximately 1/2 inch down from top tie off and bury ends in center of tassel using the top yarn attach to scarf or clasp hook and clip on scarf © on
